title: Silverdale Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Steve Lewin / Lakes near Black Bank
images.caption: Lakes near Black Bank. A couple of quite deep lakes/pools in the Silverdale Void or more correctly High Lane Void, Silverdale, the site of old opencast coal workings associated with Silverdale Colliery. Silverdale was closed in 1998, the last colliery in this area to go.

images.title: Silverdale Colliery lake by Jonathan Hutchins, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Silverdale Colliery lake

images.title: Silverdale Country Park: newly-created artificial pools by Jonathan Hutchins, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Silverdale Country Park, newly-created artificial pools

images.title: Silverdale Country Park: northern slopes of the Void by Jonathan Hutchins, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Northern slopes of the Void

images.title: Silverdale Country Park: Waste Farm Meadows by Jonathan Hutchins, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Waste Farm Meadows on the western side of the site.

images.title: Silverdale Country Park: middle track along NW slope of Void by Jonathan Hutchins, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Middle track along NW slope of Void

description: This pretty country park is located in Newcastle Under Lyme, Staffordshire. It has safe, family cycle paths and well maintained walking trails taking you around the open grassland landscape. There is a large pond which attracts great crested newts, a plateau with lovely views of the surrounding countryside, farm meadows, wilidlife conservation areas and woodland areas. The Newcastle Way walk runs past the park so you could continue your walk along this long distance path. The adjacent Apedale Country Park is also a good option if you would like to continue your outing.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: It's a popular place with dog walkers so you'll probably bump into other owners on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: A few miles south of the park you'll find the village of Keele. Here you can explore the lovely campus of Keele University which includes an arboretum, lakes and gardens. It's well laid out with several colour coded footpaths to try. For more walking ideas in the area see the Staffordshire Walks page.

display_address: Scot Hay Road, Parksite, Silverdale, Newcastle-under-Lyme, Staffordshire, England, ST5 6RA, United Kingdom
